section.title: Testing
section.para: You should test the installation using command -v. The Posix command is the standard way to check availability of a program.
section.programlisting: $ command -v xmllint /usr/bin/xmllint $ command -v xsltproc /usr/bin/xsltproc $ command -v fop /usr/local/bin/fop
section.para: You should also verify the version of fop.
If the version is unexpected then verify the shell script located in /usr/local/bin/fop, and ensure it is executable. If the script is correct then run hash -r to clear the Bash program cache.
